intro: Asyneuma limonifolium, commonly known as lemon-leaf asyneuma, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its aromatic, lemon-scented leaves. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments and has small, daisy-like yellow flowers. Its foliage is often used in traditional medicine for its purported healing properties. The species is noted for its ornamental value and adaptability to various soil types.
